remarks:
From a wff and its negation, anything is true.  Theorem *2.21 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 104.  Also called the Duns Scotus law.  (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 14-Sep-2012.) 

---

 From a wff and its negation, anything is true.  Theorem *2.21 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 104.  Also called the Duns Scotus law.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2015.)
